subject: Productivity
title: The Eight-Hour Movement
description: Learn The Eight-Hour Movement in one minute.

hook.text: Eight hours work, eight hours rest, eight hours what you will. That slogan changed labor history.

buildup.text: In the 1800s, factory workers toiled 12 to 16 hours daily. Exhaustion and injury were constant.

discovery.text: Robert Owen first proposed the eight-hour day in 1817. It took a century of strikes to win it.

twist.text: Employers fought it hard, claiming shorter days would bankrupt industry. The opposite happened.

climax.text: Shorter hours increased output per hour. Tired workers made mistakes; rested workers made products.

punchline.text: Working less made workers produce more.

quiz.question: Who first proposed the eight-hour workday?
